turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of the Bosniaks.
turn.1: What was the Ottoman conquest of Bosnia?
turn.2: The Ottoman conquest of Bosnia was notable because, unlike all other European regions that came under Ottoman control, Bosnia retained its status as a distinct entity from the very beginning (first as a sanjak, then as a province < nowiki>[</nowiki >eyalet<nowiki>]</nowiki>).
turn.3: What happened after they conquered it?
turn.4: The Ottomans imported their feudal system to Bosnia shortly after the take-over, and estates were granted to men called "sipahis", in return for military service in times of war.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: At the beginning of the Ottoman period, these estates were usually, but not exclusively, granted to Muslims, and later only to Muslims.
turn.7: Did the Christians eventually leave the area?
turn.8: In Bosnia, these land grants gradually became hereditary, and by the end of the Ottoman period, a majority of the landowners in Bosnia were Muslims, and most Christians were peasants or serfs Serbs.
turn.9: What happened to the Christians that remained?
turn.10: Probably the biggest reason behind the spread of Islam in the region was the very weak presence of the Church in Bosnia at the time.
turn.11: Did the Christians eventually get driven out?
turn.12: The old competition between the Catholic and Bosnian churches (along with the Orthodox Church in certain areas) contributed to a very weak and disorganized religious structure in much of Bosnia.
